verse.roman:
sā tadarju-samānāṅgī
bṛhac-chroṇi-payodharā
mukunda-sparśanāt sadyo
babhūva pramadottamā

synonyms: sā—she; tadā—then; ṛju—straight; samāna—even; aṅgī—her limbs; bṛhat—large; śroṇi—her hips; payaḥ-dharā—and breasts; mukunda-sparśanāt—by the touch of Lord Mukunda; sadyaḥ—suddenly; babhūva—became; pramadā—a woman; uttamā—most perfect.
translation: Simply by Lord Mukunda's touch, Trivakrā was suddenly transformed into an exquisitely beautiful woman with straight, evenly proportioned limbs and large hips and breasts.
